summary: Email correspondence between the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the release of investigation documents and photographs related to the July 23, 2019 incident involving Jeffrey Epstein. The documents are being requested for the criminal investigation with restrictions on further dissemination.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation into the July 23, 2019 incident at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. He is identified by his registration number 76318-054.

events.title: Incident involving Jeffrey Epstein at MCC
events.description: An incident involving Jeffrey Epstein occurred at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, prompting an investigation.

events.title: Request for investigation documents
events.description: The USAO SDNY Criminal Division requests documents and photographs related to the July 23, 2019 incident involving Jeffrey Epstein from the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

locations: New York Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
U.S. Department of Justice, Federal Bureau of Prisons, Northeast Regional Office, Second and Chestnut Streets, 7th Floor, Philadelphia, PA 19106
keyFacts: The document is a request from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO SDNY) for investigation materials related to a July 23, 2019 incident involving Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
The request includes memorandums and photographs from the Bureau of Prisons' investigation, which is noted as still being open.
The release of materials is conditional, with the understanding that they will not be disseminated further without the knowledge and approval of the Bureau of Prisons.
Jeffrey Epstein is identified by his federal prison registration number: 76318-054.
The correspondence highlights procedural requirements, noting that a written request (such as an email) from the USAO is sufficient to produce the documents, and a subpoena is not necessary.
